results.title: Topper
results.creator_credit: Norman McLeod, Hal Roach and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: George and Marion are killed in a car crash - but their spirits ‘live’ on, invisible, on terra firma rather than in some heavenly eternity. They discuss their predicament - and decide that they’ll have to do a good deed to go to ‘the other place’. They feel that Cosmo Topper, the bank president, should learn how to enjoy life and set about doing something about it. Some of the trouble comes from the fact that Cosmo can see them but nobody else can.

results.title: Topology
results.creator_credit: Harold Whitaker, John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
An animated film which illustrates those properties of geometric figures or solid bodies which remain invariant under certain transformations.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Topless women talk about their lives
results.creator_credit: Harry Sinclair, Fiona Copland, New Zealand Film Commission and John Swimmer Productions
results.brief_description: This fresh, low-budget, comedy of manners explores contemporary relationships through the romantic entanglements and dilemmas facing a circle of friends in their late twenties. Sinclair’s debut feature is based on a ‘micro series’ of 4 minute episodes he made for New Zealand television that followed events in the lives of a group of friends living in Auckland, and is similarly structured as a series of loosely connected episodes. Liz (Danielle Cormack) is disturbed to find that she is pregnant and potentially facing motherhood as a single mother. Her horny and geekish boyfriend (Joel Tobeck), is refusing to deal with the impending return of his other girlfriend from overseas. Prue (Willa O’Neill), Liz’s best friend, is having traumas of her own as she deals with the joys of her forthcoming marriage to Niue-born Mike (Shimpal Lelisi). Then there is the neurotic linchpin of the film, aspiring film-maker and “psychologically scarred” Ant (Ian Hughes) who experiences the trauma of attending the painfully bad premier screening of the feature film he has written. Featuring a music soundtrack by well known New Zealand acts including The Chills, The Clean, The Bats and Chris Knox, “Topless Women” effortlessly mixes comedy and drama to portray Gen-X angst.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harry Sinclair, Fiona Copland, New Zealand Film Commission and John Swimmer Productions

results.title: Topaze
results.brief_description:
Topaze, a shy and idealistic provincial schoolteacher is used as a front by a disreputable financier to sign cheques and take the rap if necessary. But he catches on fast, and ends up by appropriating both his boss’s organization and his mistress. The combination of Jouvet’s magisterial performance and the pungent dialogue of the play that made Pagnol famous is irresistible. Pagnol himself would direct it, with Armoudy in 1936 and Fernandel in 1951 in the title role, and in 1961, Peter Sellers, directed himself disastrously in ‘Mr Topaz’. Reference: Bloomsbury Foreign Film Guide.

Credits: Director, Louis Gasnier ; writer, Marcel Pagnol ; photography, Fred Langenfeld.
Cast: Louis Jouvet, Paulet, Edwige Feuillere.

results.title: Topaz [DVD]
results.brief_description: A French operative named Devereaux (Frederick Stafford) is hired by a CIA agent to travel to Cuba and investigate rumours of Russian missiles and a NATO spy group known as ‘Topaz’. They suspect there’s a traitor in the entourage of President De Gaulle. It seems that Devereaux is onto something when the investigation leads to worried governments, murder, betrayal and suicide. As he heads home to expose a double agent, his life is endangered by forces who want to keep the truth hidden. Cast includes: John Forsythe, Philippe Noiret and Dany Robin, John Vernon and Karin Dor. Screenplay by Samuel Taylor based on the novel by Leon Uris. Music composed and conducted by Maurice Jarre.

results.title: Top spin and back spin strokes
results.creator_credit: Don Kelly, Richard Hackett and Gerard Holdsworth Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Table tennis”
Part 2 of a series of four films which show that table tennis is a very competitive sport played throughout the world by people of all ages. The game is built around attacking and defensive strokes. Some of these strokes are demonstrated like: topspin; forehand drive; backhand drive; backspin, forehand chop and backhand chop.

results.title: Top shelf
results.brief_description: This stylish short animation borrows from the tradition of nastier fairytales. This creepy cautionary fable outlines what can happen to little girls who whine for toys.
